    History Erik Wilde (@dret): What is the Extensible Markup Language (XML) and how does it work?

    (3) GPX: GPS Data in XML 

    <gpx version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.topografix.com/GPX/1/1" xmlns:TPE="http://www.garmin.com/xmlschemas/TrackPointExtension/v1">
  <metadata>
    <time>2020-02-25T13:26:26.000Z</time>
  </metadata>
  <trk>
    <name>Central Park</name>
    <desc>Easy morning run in central park, with no sunshine today but at least it was dry and not too cold; explored some more of the countless small trails north of the lake.</desc>
    <type>Running</type>
    <trkseg>
      <trkpt lat="40.762783326208591461181640625" lon="-73.97837824188172817230224609375">
        <ele>21</ele>
        <time>2020-02-25T13:26:26.000Z</time>
        <extensions>
          <TPE:TrackPointExtension>
            <TPE:atemp>27.0</TPE:atemp>
            <TPE:hr>53</TPE:hr>
            <TPE:cad>0</TPE:cad>
          </TPE:TrackPointExtension>
        </extensions>
      </trkpt>
    • central-park.gpx (line 2-21)


    History Erik Wilde (@dret): What is the Extensible Markup Language (XML) and how does it work?

    (4) Data Representation on the Web



    History Erik Wilde (@dret): What is the Extensible Markup Language (XML) and how does it work?

    (5) XML-RPC and SOAP



    History Erik Wilde (@dret): What is the Extensible Markup Language (XML) and how does it work?

    (6) XML Today

    • OOXML as a format for representing office documents
    • SVG as a format for vector graphics on the Web
    • Still many SOAP APIs in production use
    • Document-oriented workflows such as in publishing


    XML Concepts

    Outline (XML Concepts)

    XML Concepts Erik Wilde (@dret): What is the Extensible Markup Language (XML) and how does it work?

    (8) XML is BYO HTML

    • It allows defining custom elements and attributes
    • Its syntax is a bit more strict than HTML (ever heard of XHTML?)
    • There are many layered technologies on top of XML itself

    (10) Example: GPS Activity Tracking



    XML in Practice Erik Wilde (@dret): What is the Extensible Markup Language (XML) and how does it work?

    (11) GPX: GPS Data in XML 

    <gpx version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.topografix.com/GPX/1/1" xmlns:TPE="http://www.garmin.com/xmlschemas/TrackPointExtension/v1">
  <metadata>
    <time>2020-02-25T13:26:26.000Z</time>
  </metadata>
  <trk>
    <name>Central Park</name>
    <desc>Easy morning run in central park, with no sunshine today but at least it was dry and not too cold; explored some more of the countless small trails north of the lake.</desc>
    <type>Running</type>
    <trkseg>
      <trkpt lat="40.762783326208591461181640625" lon="-73.97837824188172817230224609375">
        <ele>21</ele>
        <time>2020-02-25T13:26:26.000Z</time>
        <extensions>
          <TPE:TrackPointExtension>
            <TPE:atemp>27.0</TPE:atemp>
            <TPE:hr>53</TPE:hr>
            <TPE:cad>0</TPE:cad>
          </TPE:TrackPointExtension>
        </extensions>
      </trkpt>
    • central-park.gpx (line 2-21)
